name: Farin Ruwa Falls
address: Massange village of Farin Ruwa Development Area in Wamba Local Government Area of Nasarawa State, Nigeria
description: Farin Ruwa Falls is a waterfall found in the central region of Nigeria. It is among the highest waterfalls in Nigeria. Farin Ruwa Waterfalls is often referred to as the “White Waterfall.”

name: Eggon Hills
address: Located near the town of Akwanga Local Government Area of Nasarawa State, Nigeria
description: The Eggon Hills are part of a mountain range that offers sweeping views of the surrounding plains, villages, and farmlands. These hills provide a fantastic spot for hiking, picnicking, and sightseeing.

name: Maloney Hill
address: Keffi Local Government Area of Nasarawa State, Nigeria
description: This is a tourist site named after Captain C.W. Maloney, who was the British colonial representative in that area.

name: Ara Rock
address: Ara Town in Nasarawa Local Government Area of Nasarawa State in central Nigeria.
description: Ara Rock is a towering monolith that stands out against the landscape. It achieves a remarkable height of about 120 metres (390 ft) above the surface of the neighbouring plains and it attracts many people to Ara town on sightseeing visits.

name: Keana Salt Village
address: Keana town in Keana Local Government Area of Nasarawa State, Nigeria
description: Keana Salt Village, nestled in a quiet corner of the town, is known for its traditional salt production using local technology.

name: Akwanga Forest Reserve
address: Located in Akwanga Local Government Area of Nasarawa State, Nigeria
description: The area has forest savannahs, which are dry woodlands with fertile alluvial soils.

name: Doma Dam
address: Located in Doma Local Government Area of Nasarawa State, Nigeria
description: This large dam is surrounded by beautiful landscapes, offering a perfect setting for fishing, boating, and picnics. The calm waters reflect the sky and surrounding greenery, creating a serene ambience that’s hard to beat.

name: Akiri Warm Springs
address: Located in Awe Local Government Area of Nasarawa State, Nigeria
description: Known for its soothing, warm waters, the spring attracts both locals and tourists who believe in its therapeutic benefits. The water temperatures remain warm throughout the year, providing a relaxing and rejuvenating experience for visitors.
